lines.content: * ChoiceBot is a chatbot used to add, delete and manage tasks using command inputs.
* Constructs and runs an instance of ChoiceBot using the specified file path.
* @param filePath File used to load and save task list data.
* The entry point of the chatbot.
* Represents an exception specific to ChoiceBot.
* The exception is thrown when an error occurs during the running of ChoiceBot, such as invalid user input.
* Constructs a ChoiceBotException with the specified message explaining the error causing the exception.
* Represents a command that can be executed by ChoiceBot application.
* Each command type inherits this superclass and overrides the execute method.
* Executes the command using the given task list and user interface.
* @param tasks Task list in current instance.
* @param ui User interface in current instance.
* @throws ChoiceBotException If an error occurs during command execution.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, UI ui) throws ChoiceBotException {
* Represents a command that creates and adds a Deadline task to tasklist.
* A deadline follows the format: deadline {description} /by {yyyy-mm-dd}
* Constructs a DeadlineCommand with the given description.
* @param description Contains name of Deadline, and due date.
* Executes the deadline command by creating new deadline instance.
* The deadline instance is added to given task list and saved to storage.
* Displays a confirmation message through given UI.
* @param tasks Task list in current instance.
* @param ui User interface in current instance.
* @throws ChoiceBotException If command does not have /by, or deadline name or due date is blank.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, UI ui) throws ChoiceBotException {
Task deadline = new Deadline(deadlineName, false, dueDate);
throw new ChoiceBotException("Please use format \"yyyy-mm-dd\" for deadline.");
* Represents a command that deletes a task from tasklist.
* Constructs a DeleteCommand with the given task index.
* @param description Index of task to be deleted from task list.
* Executes the delete command by deleting specified task number from task list.
* The task instance is also deleted from storage.
* Displays a confirmation message through given UI.
* @param tasks Task list in current instance.
* @param ui User interface in current instance.
* @throws ChoiceBotException If index of task is not found in task list, or if description is blank.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, UI ui) throws ChoiceBotException {
throw new ChoiceBotException("Please provide a task number to delete.");
throw new ChoiceBotException("No tasks available to delete.");
"Invalid task number. Please input a task number from 1 to %d",
throw new ChoiceBotException("Sorry! Task number must be an integer.");
* Represents a command that creates and adds an Event task to tasklist.
* An Event follows the format: event {description} /from {time} /to {time}
* Constructs an EventCommand with the given description.
* @param description Contains name of Event, and start and end date/time.
* Executes the Event command by creating new Event instance.
* The Event instance is added to given task list and saved to storage.
* Displays a confirmation message through given UI.
* @param tasks Task list in current instance.
* @param ui User interface in current instance.
* @throws ChoiceBotException If command does not have /from, /to, or if name, start, or end date/time missing.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, UI ui) throws ChoiceBotException {
Task event = new Event(eventName, false, from, to);
* Represents a command that exits from the application.
* Executes the chatbot, displaying a confirmation message through given UI.
* @param tasks Task list in current instance.
* @param ui User interface in current instance.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, UI ui) {
* Represents a command to find tasks that contain a given keyword in the task description.
* Constructs a FindCommand with the given search keyword.
* Executes the find command by filtering tasks that contain the given keyword.
* Displays all filtered tasks to the user using the given UI.
* Displays no task found message if no matching tasks available.
* @param tasks Task list in current instance.
* @param ui User interface in current instance.
* @throws ChoiceBotException If the keyword is empty.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, UI ui) throws ChoiceBotException {
throw new ChoiceBotException("Please provide a keyword to search with.");
* Represents a command that displays the current task list.
* @param description Must be empty, not required here.
* Executes the List command by displaying the current task list through given UI.
* @param tasks Task list in current instance.
* @param ui User interface in current instance.
* @throws ChoiceBotException If description is not blank.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, UI ui) throws ChoiceBotException {
throw new ChoiceBotException("Please only type the command \"list\"");
* Represents a command that marks a given task in the tasklist.
* The task is chosen through the given index.
* Constructs a MarkCommand with the given description.
* @param description Contains index of task to be marked.
* Executes the Mark command by marking the given task index.
* The stored task list is also updated with the mark.
* Displays a confirmation message through given UI.
* @param tasks Task list in current instance.
* @param ui User interface in current instance.
* @throws ChoiceBotException If task number given is out of range, not given, or task list is empty.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, UI ui) throws ChoiceBotException {
throw new ChoiceBotException("Please provide a task number to mark.");
throw new ChoiceBotException("No tasks available to mark.");
"Invalid task number. Please input a task number from 1 to %d",
throw new ChoiceBotException("Sorry! Task number must be an integer.");
* Represents a command that creates and adds a Todo Event to the task list.
* A Todo follows the format: todo {description}
* Constructs a Todo Event with the given description.
* @param description Contains name of the Todo Event.
* Executes the Todo command by creating new Todo instance.
* The Todo instance is added to given task list and saved to storage.
* Displays a confirmation message through given UI.
* @param tasks Task list in current instance.
* @param ui User interface in current instance.
* @throws ChoiceBotException If description is null or blank.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, UI ui) throws ChoiceBotException {
throw new ChoiceBotException("Please add a description for toDo event.");
* Represents a command that unmarks a given task in the tasklist.
* The task is chosen through the given index.
* Constructs an UnmarkCommand with the given description.
* @param description Contains index of task to be unmarked.
* Executes the Unmark command by unmarking the given task index.
* The stored task list is also updated with the unmark.
* Displays a confirmation message through given UI.
* @param tasks Task list in current instance.
* @param ui User interface in current instance.
* @throws ChoiceBotException If task number given is out of range, not given, or task list is empty.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, UI ui) throws ChoiceBotException {
throw new ChoiceBotException("Please provide a task number to unmark.");
throw new ChoiceBotException("No tasks available to unmark.");

throw new ChoiceBotException("Sorry! Task number must be an integer.");
* Parser class interprets user input and converts it to an executable Command.
* Parses the given user input into a Command.
* The first word in the user input is treated as the command keyword,
* and the rest of the input is passed to the command as its description.
* @param command The actual input from the user.
* @return a Command object representing the parsed input.
* @throws ChoiceBotException if the user input does not match any valid command.
public static Command parse(String command) throws ChoiceBotException {
throw new ChoiceBotException("Invalid input. Please try again.");
* The Storage class handles reading and writing tasks from a local file to the program.
* Tasks are stored line by line, with each line being a formatted representation of the Task.

throw new ChoiceBotException("Could not read tasks from file: " + e.getMessage());
* Saves the given Tasklist to the storage file in formatted representation.

* Represents a collection of Task objects.

* Displays a message after deleting a task.

* Displays an error message when a ChoiceBotException occurs.
* Displays a message after adding a task.
displayMessage("Got it. I've added this task: ");

displayMessage("\tOk, I've unmarked the following task for you: ");
* Displays a message after marking a task.

* @param taskList The list of tasks to be displayed.
displayMessage("\tHere are the tasks in your list:");
* Displays the exit message when the conversation with ChoiceBot ends.
say("ChoiceBot", ": Thanks for stopping by! See you again!");

assertEquals("[T][ ] read book", new Todo("read book", false).toString());
